title: Missouri National Recreational River: Mobile Ranger Station
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go     Mobile Ranger Station              Mobile Ranger Station        The Mobile Ranger Station ready for visitors NPS photo         Welcome to the visitor center on wheels! NPS photo  The Visitor Center That Brings the Park to the People! The Missouri National Recreational River's Mobile Ranger Station is our visitor center on wheels. Look for it throughout the 98-mile River corridor from Fort Randall Dam to Ponca State Park, and at special events in South Dakota, Nebraska, and Iowa, and at our National Parks. The mobile visitor center helps to convey information about the Missouri River and the National Park through exhibits and activities for all ages. Park Rangers are also present at the station to greet and introduce you to your National Park.    Would you like to have the Mobile Ranger Station visit your school or community event? Please call 605-665-0209 for more information.        Interior of Mobile Ranger Station with interactive map. NPS photo  Mobile Ranger Station Location In between traveling to special events and programs, the Mobile Ranger Station may be found near the Meridian Bridge in Yankton, from 10:00 am to 4:00 pm Tuesday through Friday, June through August.
